result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry N Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,150.00 to Jomela Properties 5601 W. North Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Jasmine W., Daniel H. or Kiara C.-E. without approval of the Court.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention  counseling and continued programming.
Successfully complete any other ocunseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are retored.

Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of Extended supervision or civil judgment.
Also to pay costs and fees for cases 13CM4457 and 14CF1458.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry N Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: judgment done in error $250.00, not due yet.
Transcript SENTENCING HEARING commencing JULY 23, 2014 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1458  (36 Pages).
14A 025578  NOTE: Bail was reinstated and applied after case was closed.
Restituion has been ordered. Bail was ordered held for recompense

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Melvina Harris Thompson.

 AS TO COUNT #3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, with credit for 112 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victims, 
  -- Jasmine W., Daniel H.,or Kiara C-E.,
   without approval of the court. 
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   Also to pay costs and fees for cases:
   --- 2013CM4457 and 2014CF1458.
* Parties Stipulate to Restitution to Jomela Properties, 
   5601 W. North Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1 and COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-23-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Henry N. Evans in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 For the reasons as stated on the record, the Court heard and granted State's Motion to Admit the 911 Transcript.  Defense objected to the admission of the 911 call.   Parties remain in trial posture.  Case passed to afternoon.   mld

received and filed.
 COUNT 3, Bal Jumping (felony), Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Contrary to Wisconsin Statute(s) 946.49(1)(b), 968.075(1)(a) and 939.62(1)(b), a Class H Felony.   mld

Attorney Calvin Malone in court for Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont, defendant Henry N Evans not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel is unavailable due to a family emergency.  Attorney Malone advised the court that defense counsel will be available and prepared to proceed on the trial date of 7-14-2014 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Upon the request of parties, case adjourned for further Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-10-2014 at 8:30 pm.  Parties are working on a possible resolution.   mld
Discharge Summary Report from Justice Point received and filed.  Defendant is currently in custody status and has been discharged from Pretrial Supervision.   mld
with all conditions of Justice Point Supervision continued.   mld
Cash bail to be held for recompense, per the Court.   mld

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  All available discovery was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for trial:  Cases 2013CF5170, 2014CF862 and 2014CF1458.  Defense objects to the consolidation of cases.  The Court would consider any brief or motion filed by defense regarding the consolidation of cases.  Court ordered case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-12-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-14-2014 at 8:30 am.    

For the reasons as stated on the record, the Court forfeited the cash bail in the amount of $800.00 on case 2014CF862.  Court ordered cash bail to be held for recompense.  mld

 Defendant appeared after defense counsel vacated the courtroom.  Court admonished defendant for being late for today's proceedings.  For the reqasons as stated on the record, Court ordered cash bail increased in the amount of $50.00 on case 2014CF862.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 4-25-2014 at 8:30 am.   Court vacates the Status Conference date of 5-7-2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 2.   mld

 Status Conference held off the record.  Defendant has another case (2013CF5170), that may have been wrongly tabbed to branch #2).  Case may be a domestic violence related case.  To determine the status of both cases, case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 4-22-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Henry N Evans not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 04
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jasmine W.

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
